result.execSummary:
The defendant Casey E. Bender was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).
  • Possess Drug Paraphernalia, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.573(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Defendant Casey E. Bender in court with attorney Mark H. Bennett.  Troy D Cross appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Amended Complaint filed, waives reading of complaint, Defendant pleads no contest to Ct. 1, and Ct. 2, Judgment to be entered, 14 TR 5582 and 14 TR 5583 Court grants motion to reopened and dismisses matters, Court withholds sentence, probation 2 years on each count, Ct. 1, $443.00 costs, AODA and comply, Ct. 2, $443.00 costs, AODA and comply, 1 day sentence credit
